front.title: NERD: A Not-so-novel EID to RLOC Database

abstract.t: LISP is a protocol to encapsulate IP packets in order to allow end sites to multihome without injecting routes from one end of the Internet to another. This memo specifies a database and a method to transport the mapping of EIDs to RLOCs to routers in a reliable, scalable, and secure manner. Our analysis concludes that transport of of all EID/RLOC mappings scales well to at least 10^8 entries, and that use of DNS or any approach that queries for mappings has substantial operational concerns.
